A 5-year-old female child came to OPD with the complaints of photophobia, bilateral lacrimation. eye itching, and eyelid swelling for the last week. She is known to have an allergy to cephalosporins. She was born at 39 weeks gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery. She has met all of her developmental milestones and most of her vaccines. Her vital signs are normal. The physical examination is mostly normal except for her eye exam as presented in the image shown here. Which of the following statements is true regarding treatment of this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: A third-generation cephalosporin would be the best treatment option in case the child did not have an actual allergy.

options.label: B
options.text: The child should be treated with topical bacitracin.

options.label: C
options.text: The child should be administered a single dose of oral azithromycin.

options.label: D
options.text: The best treatment option is oral tetracycline.

questions.correct_answer: C. The child should be administered a single dose of oral azithromycin.

A microbiologist is studying the structure and function of bacterial cell walls. In an experiment group A streptococci are treated with chemicals to solubilize the cell wall. Various cell wall-associated proteins are subsequently extracted. Electron microscopic evaluation of a specific protein shows structural homology with mammalian tropomyosin and myosin. This protein acts as a virulence factor for certain species of the organism. Which of the following is the most likely function of this bacterial cell wall-associated protein?

A diarrheal outbreak is reported from a ship to Andaman. Six healthy children aged 10-11 and two adults developed acute vomiting and diarrhea within a 2- day period. They describe the diarrhea as watery and without blood or mucus. Three of those affected are febrile during their illness. None of the patients have traveled abroad recently, and all are up to date with their immunizations. Stool test results are pending. Which of the following pathogens is the most likely cause of the illness?

A 30-year-old woman presents to her primary care provider complaining of intermittent fever and loss of appetite for the past 2 weeks. She is also concerned about painful genital lesions. Past medical history is non-contributory. She takes oral contraceptives and a multivitamin daily. She has had two mate sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently. She admits to being sexually active with 2 partners in the last 3 months and only using condoms on occasion. Today, her vitals are normal. On pelvic exam, shown in the image with swollen and tender inguinal lymph nodes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?

A 24 -year-old woman presents to her gynecologist complaining of some mild pelvic discomfort and some frothy yellowish discharge from her vagina for the past 2 weeks. She also complains of pain during sexual intercourse and sometimes after urination. Past medical history is non-contributory. She takes oral contraceptives and multivitamins daily. She has had two male sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently. Today, her Vitals are normal. On pelvic exam, she has vulvovaginal erythema and a 'strawberry cervix' that is tender to motion with it minimal green-yellow malodorous discharge. A 7-year-old boy with a history of cystic fibrosis is brought to the physician for evaluation of recurrent episodes of productive cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath over the past month. Physical examination shows coarse crackles and expiratory wheezing over both lung fields. Serum studies show elevated levels of IgE and eosinophilia. A CT scan of the lungs shows centrally dilated bronchi with thickened walls and peripheral airspace consolidation. Antibiotic therapy is initiated. One week later, the patient continues to show deterioration in lung function. A sputum culture is most likely to grow which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Monomorphic, septate hyphae that branch at acute angles

questions.correct_answer: B. Monomorphic, septate hyphae that branch at acute angles

options.label: B
options.text: Inner hair cells are less resistant.

options.label: C
options.text: There are 3-4 rows of inner hair cells which are arranged in rows in a pattern of a W.

A 73-year-old female with a history of well-controlled diabetes recently underwent uncomplicated phacoemulsification with a posterior chamber intraocular lens and complains of blurry vision. Best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) is 6/18. Her fluorescein angiogram is given. What is not true?

options.label: B

options.text: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is true but reason is false

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is false but reason is true

questions.correct_answer: C. Assertion is true but reason is false

A 54-year-old man presents with sudden onset of massive, painless, recurrent hematemesis. Upper endoscopy is performed and reveals bleeding point from a lesion in the proximal stomach, lesser curvature below GE junction with normal mucosa (figure shown below). Endoscopic modalities fail to stop the bleeding. Which of the following is the most appropriate surgical management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Wedge resection of the lesion with highly selective vagotomy

options.label: C
options.text: Wedge resection of the lesion with truncal vagotomy and antrectomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Wedge resection of the lesion

A 55-year-old white female undergoes a laparoscopic cholecystectomy for symptomatic cholelithiasis. One week later, she comes to your office for a routine postoperative follow-up. The final pathology report shows an incidental finding of a gallbladder carcinoma confined to the mucosa. Which of the following is best advice for her?

options.label: A
options.text: She does not require any further therapy.

options.label: B
options.text: She should undergo right hepatectomy to remove locally infiltrating disease.

questions.correct_answer: A. She does not require any further therapy.

A patient who was on chemotherapy presented with fever, pain, Guarding and tenderness in RIF. Stool Guaiac test was positive. His Hb was 11.5 Gm%, platelet count was 1.5 lacks and TLC count was 900/cmm. Which of the following is most probable diagnosis?

Which of the following is most common cause of post op thyroid storm?

options.label: A
options.text: Rought handling of thyroid during surgery.

options.label: B
options.text: Poor pre-operative preparation euthyroid control of patient.

options.label: C
options.text: Vessel were not ligated prior to thyroid mobilization

options.label: D
options.text: Cross reaction of scoline and malignanat hyperthermia

questions.correct_answer: B. Poor pre-operative preparation euthyroid control of patient.

questions.text: False statement about Rhomboid flap is?

questions.text: Identify the cast in this image:

A 56-year-old male with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, hypertension, and chronic kidney disease presents to the emergency department complaining of dyspnea and productive cough with green sputum for the past two days. He is able to answer all questions appropriately and says that he had a similar episode a few months ago for which he went to the hospital but did not recall the details. His blood pressure is 140/80 mmHg, his pulse is 110 bpm and regular, and his respiratory rate is 28/min. On exam, his breathing appears laboured, and wheezing is across all lung fields. Labs show a serum Na of 134 mEq/L, K of 4.5 mEq/L, BUN of 20 mg/dL, and Cr of 1.5 mg/L. His blood gas specimen shows a pH of 7.24, PCO2 of 60 mmHg, and PO2 of 70 mmHg on room air. Chest X-ray shows hyperinflated lungs but is otherwise unremarkable. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial treatment?

options.label: C
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation via continuous positive airway pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation via bilevel positive airway pressure

questions.correct_answer: D. Positive pressure ventilation via bilevel positive airway pressure

questions.text: Which condition is typically associated with a sudden increase in the end-tidal carbon dioxide (ETCO2) waveform during anesthesia?

A 55-year-old male patient with a history of renal failure requires rapid sequence induction for emergency surgery. Which of the following statements regarding succinylcholine use in renal failure is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Succinylcholine is contraindicated in patients with renal failure due to the risk of nephrotoxicity.

options.label: B
options.text: Succinylcholine should be used cautiously in patients with renal failure due to prolonged duration of action.

options.label: C
options.text: Succinylcholine is the preferred muscle relaxant in patients with renal failure due to its rapid metabolism.

options.label: D
options.text: Succinylcholine dosage should be doubled in patients with renal failure to achieve adequate muscle relaxation.

questions.correct_answer: B. Succinylcholine should be used cautiously in patients with renal failure due to prolonged duration of action.

questions.text: Which of the following local anesthetics is associated with a higher risk of cardiotoxicity, including the potential for arrhythmias?

12 year old girl has a history of 1 year of constant grammatical mistakes and spelling errors. But her performance in other subjects is average, she performs good in oral assesment and there is no difficulty in reading. Most probable diagnosis?

A 30 year old unmarried woman from lower socioeconomic status family believes that a rich boy staying in her neighbourhood is in deep love with her. The boy clearly denies his love towards this lady. Still the lady insists that his denial is a secret affirmation of his love towards her. She makes desperate attempts to meet the boy despite resistance from her family. She also develops sadness at times when her effort to meet the boy does not materialize. She is able to maintain her daily routine. She however, remains preoccupied with the thoughts this boy. She is likely to be suffering from:
A patient comes in stupor condition, patient’s parents give history of being continually sad and suicidal attempts, not eating and sleeping most of the time. The treatment is
Which one of the following components of HPV virus is used in the making of HPV vaccine GARDASIL?

A 52 years old multiparous, post-menopausal patient has vaginal bleeding since last 3 months. On TVS. There was a 2 cm mass seen on the posterior wall of endometrium. What is the next line of management?

options.label: C
options.text: Do an exploratory laparotomy and debulking surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Do laparoscopic hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

questions.correct_answer: B. Do a hysteroscopy guided biopsy

questions.text: A 72 years old postmenopausal patient underwent vaginal hysterectomy for uterine prolapse. She said that she was able to pass urine on her own and the volume of urine passed was same as before. What is the likely cause of this condition?

A newborn child is identified by newborn screen as having an elevated immunoreactive trypsinogen level of 70 nanogram (ng)/mL and a single copy of CFTR-DeltaF508 mutation. What is the next step?

questions.correct_answer: D. Perform diagnostic sweat chloride testing.

questions.text: Which of the following gastrointestinal complications of CF is least likely to occur in infancy?

A friend's teenage son is eating peanuts when he starts laughing. He subsequently starts to cough and choke. He appears anxious and makes a hand gesture toward his throat. At this point, he is no longer coughing. What should be done next?

options.label: C
options.text: Perform back blows and chest compressions.

options.label: D
options.text: Do not intervene unless he loses consciousness.

options.label: E
options.text: Sign up for a cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) course.

questions.text: You suspect the etiology of a child's AKI to be prerenal but you want to be sure you are not missing intrinsic kidney disease, such as acute tubular necrosis (ATN) . Which finding will help confirm a prerenal etiology?

options.label: A
options.text: Fractional excretion of sodium greater than 1 % .

options.label: D
options.text: Fractional excretion of sodium less than 1 %.

questions.correct_answer: D. Fractional excretion of sodium less than 1 %.

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl presents to your office with complaints of abdominal pain and foul-smelling urine. She does not have fever and is in no distress. Her mother states this is likely another episode of UTI. She had two other episodes last year for which she received antibiotics. The mother does not remember if urine cultures were obtained then. The mother also notes that her daughter has daytime accidents on most days of the week at kindergarten. She is also constipated. You decide to wait for the formal urinalysis and culture before prescribing antibiotics. Urinalysis shows specific gravity greater than 1 .030, 50 WBCs/HPF, 5 RBCs/HPF, 1 + protein, and many bacteria. What investigations would you like to pursue at this time?

The family is a young couple who bring their 4-month-old infant boy to see you. While very happy about the birth of their first child, they are a bit worried. They tell you that their son looks smaller than his same-age cousin, who outweighs him by 4 pounds. He throws up a lot, and they are not sure if this is normal. Even though he throws up, he still makes plenty of wet diapers each day. You confirm that he is below the fifth percentile for both length and weight. You wonder if something in the water is causing kidney problems in every infant in your clinic today, but decide that you should obtain some basic lab studies first. The serum chemistry looks something like this: Na 142 mEq/L, K 3.2 mEq/L, Cl 1 1 5 mEq/L, and C02 10 mEq/L. To make a diagnosis of renal tubular acidosis, you should see all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.correct_answer: E. Normal to low serum chloride.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a radiographic finding of physical child abuse?

options.label: E
options.text: All of the above are radiographic findings of physical child abuse.

questions.correct_answer: E. All of the above are radiographic findings of physical child abuse.

questions.text: An adolescent boy with cystic fibrosis is admitted because of an acute decline in pulmonary function. His weight is down 2 kg from 3 months ago. He has not filled any prescriptions for 2 months. Which nutritional problem is he unlikely to have related to his cystic fibrosis?

A 15-month-old boy is referred for evaluation of anemia (hemoglobin 10 mg/dL) . You learn the infant has been receiving cow's milk since 9 months of age. What is the best next course of action in the care of this 15-month-old?

options.label: E
options.text: Repeat his blood work in 3 months.

questions.correct_answer: B. Start empiric treatment with iron.

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy is brought for evaluation because of gait concerns. Gestational and birth histories were unremarkable, and he started walking at 18 months. However, recently he began having difficulty going up the stairs, and now he has to pull himself up holding onto the hand-rails. He is slightly behind his peers in terms of learning. He has not had any recent illnesses. There is no pertinent family history. On exam, you note hypotonia and enlarged calf muscles. When he runs, a waddling gait is apparent. When he stands up from the floor, he places his hands on his knees and then his thighs to stand up. What would you do next?

options.label: A
options.text: Start physical therapy and see how he improves. Follow up in 6 months.

Which of the following is the true statement in relation to radiation sensitivity of the tissues?

options.label: A
options.text: Rapidly dividing cells are resistant to radiation

options.label: B
options.text: Gl Mucosa is one of the most radioresistant tissues in the GIT I

options.label: C
options.text: The dose of the radiation is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source

options.label: D
options.text: Small vessels are resistant to radiation

questions.correct_answer: C. The dose of the radiation is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the source
